get.description:
This Service is used to for Card / APM processing.

This request type can be used to get the transaction status and details using the id (Token) recieved from a previous transaction.

This Service is used to for Card / APM processing.

This request type can be used to get the transaction status and details using the Transaction reference (clientSystemTransactionId or clientSystemInvoiceId) supplied in the original transaction request. The response will be an array of responses, as more than one transaction could use the same clientSystemInvoiceId

parameters.name: optionalResponseFields
parameters.description: (This paremeter can be optionally sent in multiple times, with the possible values listed below)

get.description:
This Service is used to for Card / APM processing.

This request type can be used to get the transaction status and details using the Transaction reference (clientSystemTransactionId or clientSystemInvoiceId) and optionally narroring down to a specific Single Use Token (singleUseTokenId) supplied in the original transaction request.

Note: If singleUseTokenId is NOT provided, then the response will be an array of responses.

parameters.name: optionalResponseFields
parameters.description: (This paremeter can be optionally sent in multiple times, with the possible values listed below)

oneOf.title: Authorised (With singleUseToken NOT provided in request)

post.description:
This Service is used to for Card / APM processing.

This request type can be used to process supported APMs transactions.

merchantId.description: [Length=3] This is the customer code, a unique customer ID allocated to a customer when the service is set up

storeId.description: [Length=12] This is the site identifier, a unique site ID allocated to a customer when the service is set up

userId.description: [Length<=50] This is a username allocated to a service user when the service is set up; it refers to a service account not a person

type.description: This is a combination of how the card was captured and transaction type of the transaction. i.e. mailorder.sale, internet.preAuthorization. Refer to Type under Elements

amount.description: This is the monetary value of the transaction in minor units

currencyCode.description: [Length=3] This is the currency of the transaction.  This is the currency code. A three character code in accordance with ISO 4217

clientSystemTransactionId.description: [Length<=50] This is the merchant's own unique reference for the transaction

clientSystemInvoiceId.description: [Length<=50] Required for AliPay/Wechat/Klarna, this is the clientSystemTransactionId from the original transaction

providerDiscretionaryData.description: [Length<=50] This is the merchant's external facing order number with the consumer, which if supported, will be passed to the Provider as an additional descriptor.

apmProviderName.description: This is the alternative payment method provider name. Refer to APM Providers under Elements

apmPayerAccountNumber.description: [Length<=50] This is the unique account number of the payer for the chosen alternative payment method provider

apmPayerEmailAddress.description: [Length<=255] This is the e-mail address of the payer for the chosen alternative payment method provider

apmBarQrCode.description: [Length<=128] Required for AliPay/Wechat Sale transactions, this is the Bar or QR code scanned by the merchant device

apmOriginalAmount.description: Required for AliPay/Wechat Refunds, this is the monetary value of the original transaction in minor units

apmProviderTransactionId.description: [Length<=32] Required for AliPay/Wechat Refunds, this contains the Provider Transaction Id from the original transaction being refunded

providerMerchantId.description: [Length<=20] Optional for AliPay/Wechat, this is the Merchant Id that will be used when requesting authorization through the acquirer.

productId.description:
[Length<=64] This is the client facing article number, SKU or similar.
Optional for Klarna

productName.description:
[Length<=100] This is the merchant's descriptive product name for the item line
Optional for Klarna

productDescription.description:
[Length<=100] This is the merchant's product description for the item line
Optional for Klarna

productType.description:
This is the type of product being sold for the item line
Supported values are "physical", "digital", "giftCard", "surcharge"
Optional for Klarna

productQuantity.description:
[Length<=4] This is the quantity for the item line. Allowed values are 1-9999
Optional for Klarna

unitAmount.description:
This is the monetary value (Gross Amount) in minor units for the item line.
Must include tax if applicable, but exclude any discount
Optional for Klarna

unitTaxAmount.description:
This is the monetary value of the tax amount in minor units for the item line.
(Example: If the unitAmount is 20.00 and taxRate is 20%, then the unitTaxAmount would be 3.33 ) (((unitAmount/1.taxRate) - unitAmount) * -1)
Required if taxRate > 0 and unitAmount > 0
Conditional for Klarna

taxRate.description:
[Length<=5] This is the tax rate that that is being applied to the unitAmount for the item line.
(Example: VAT of 20% would mean a value of 20 being supplied)
If no tax applies, then send 0 or do not include this element
Conditional - Required if item.unitTaxAmount is supplied

totalAmount.description:
This is the monetary value of the total amount in minor units for the item line. ((unitAmount x productQuantity) - discountAmount)
Must include tax and any discount if applicable
(Example: If the unitAmount is 34.00, productQuantity is 2 and discountAmount is 5.00, then the totalAmount would be 63.00)
Optional for Klarna

totalTaxAmount.description:
This is the monetary value of the total tax amount in minor units for the item line. (totalAmount/1.taxRate) - totalAmount) * -1)
(Example: If the totalAmount is 63.00 and taxRate is 20%, then the totalTaxAmount would be 10.50 ) (((totalAmount/1.taxRate) - totalAmount) * -1)
Required if taxRate > 0

discountAmount.description:
This is the non-negative monetary value of the discount amount in minor units for the item line.
Optional for Klarna

discountName.description:
[Length<=100] This is the name of the discount or promotion being used for the item line.
Required if item.discountAmount > 0

discountTaxAmount.description:
This is the tax amount of the discount or promotion being used for the item line.
(Example: If the discountAmount is 5.00 and taxRate is 20%, then the discountTaxAmount would be 0.83 ) (((discountAmount/1.taxRate) - discountAmount) * -1)
Required if taxRate > 0 and discountAmount > 0

shippingName.description:
[Length<=100] This is the name of the Shipping service for the order (Example: DHL 24hr Next Day Express)
Required if shippingAmount > 0

shippingAmount.description: This is the monetary value of the total shipping amount in minor units for the entire order.

shippingTaxAmount.description:
This is the monetary value of the total shipping amount in minor units for the item line. (totalAmount * taxRate / 100)
(Example: If the shippingAmount is 5.00 and taxRate is 20%, then the shippingAmount would be 0.83 ) (((shippingAmount/1.taxRate) - shippingAmount) * -1)
Required if shippingTaxRate > 0 and shippingAmount > 0

shippingTaxRate.description:
[Length<=5] This is the tax rate that that is being applied to the shippingAmount for the entire order.
(Example: VAT of 20% would mean a value of 20 being supplied)

discountAmount.description:
This is the non-negative monetary value of the discount amount in minor units for the entire order.
Optional for Klarna

discountType.description:
This is the Type of the discount or promotion being used for the entire order.
Accepted values are discount, storeCredit and giftCard
Conditional - Required if discountDetails.discount.discountAmount is supplied

discountName.description:
[Length<=100] This is the Name of the discount or promotion being used for the entire order.
Conditional - Required if discountDetails.discount.discountAmount is supplied

totaltaxAmount.description:
This is the monetary value of the total tax amount in minor units for the entire order, including any shipping tax.
Sum of all itemDetails.item.totalTaxAmount already calculated at a per line level plus shippingTaxAmount)
Required if taxRate > 0 or shippingTaxRate > 0

message.example: Error getting customer site for site no 1

post.description:
This Service is used to for Card / APM processing.

This request type can be used to process card transactions using a Card Number (Plain or encrypted), a Tokenised Card Number, a Single Use Token or a Visa Checkout Call Id across all card schemes.

Optional Authentication methods include AVS/CSC, 3D Secure

merchantId.description: [Length=3] This is the customer code, a unique customer ID allocated to a customer when the service is set up

storeId.description: [Length=12] This is the site identifier, a unique site ID allocated to a customer when the service is set up

userId.description: [Length<=50] This is a username allocated to a service user when the service is set up; it refers to a service account not a person

type.description: This is a combination of how the card was captured and transaction type of the transaction. i.e. mailorder.sale, internet.preAuthorization. Refer to Type under Elements

amount.description: This is the monetary value of the transaction in minor units

currencyCode.description: [Length=3] This is the currency of the transaction.  This is the currency code. A three character code in accordance with ISO 4217

clientSystemInvoiceId.description: [Length<=50] This is the merchant's own unique Invoice Id for the transaction, only used when a transaction is a PreAuthorization, Top Up or Capture

clientSystemTransactionId.description: [Length<=50] This is the merchant's own unique reference for the transaction

providerDiscretionaryData.description:
[Length<=75] This is the merchant's external facing order number with the consumer, which if supported, will be passed to the Provider as an additional descriptor.
For Vantiv by FIS, chars 1-35 are sent in user defined field 01, 36-55 in field 02 and 56-75 in field 03. If not present, the clientSystemInvoiceId is sent in this field instead. Information in this field appears in Vantiv reports

MerchantReferenceData.description:
[Length<=28] This is the a merchant's order/Reference number with the consumer, which if supported, will be passed to the Provider as an additional descriptor.
For Vantiv by FIS, this data is used to populate 'G001- Merchant Reference Data' with chars 1-11 sent in Draft Locator Id and 12-28 sent as Merchant Reference Number. Information in this field appears in Vantiv reports

isFinalCapture.description:
[True / False] If set to TRUE, the remaining authorised amount, if any, will be reveresed and returned to the card holder. (Defaulted to FALSE if not supplied)
*Supported with PXP Financial Acquiring Only*

forcePaymentFollowingDecline.description:
[True / False] If set to TRUE, should an online sale be declined, it will be subsequently re-processed and forced offline.
"Authorised" will be returned if the online sale approved
"Approved" will be returned if the online sale declined, and was approved offline.
(Defaulted to FALSE if not supplied)
*Supported with PXP Financial Acquiring Only*

authorityMethod.description:
This is the method in which the payment should gain approval.
Supported Values: "online" or "offline"
(Defaulted to "online" if not supplied)
*Supported with PXP Financial Acquiring Only*

originalTransactionId.description: [Length=36] This is the "id" returned from ANYpay from the original Transaction. This is required for processing reversals.

cardSchemeReference.description: Contains the Acquirer Bank Data returned in the Initial Recurring Response. Must be present in Subsequent Recurring Request

providerMerchantId.description: [Length<=20] This is the Merchant Id that will be used when requesting authorization through the acquirer.  If the providerMerchantId is not populated PXP will associate the Merchant Id based on card and currency

cardNumber.description:
[Length<=19] This is the card number of the card holder
(CONDITIONAL: Either cardNumber, cardTokenisedNumber, tokenID or callId is required)

cardTokenizedNumber.description:
[Length=19] This is the tokenised card number returned from PXP from a previous transaction
(CONDITIONAL: Either cardNumber, cardTokenisedNumber, tokenID or callId is required)

tokenId.description:
[Length=36] This is the unique Single Use Token ID provided by PXP following a Single use Token transaction
(CONDITIONAL: Either cardNumber, cardTokenisedNumber, tokenID or callId is required)

callId.description:
[Length<=36] This is the Token to represent the card from VisaCheckout
(CONDITIONAL: Either cardNumber, cardTokenisedNumber, tokenID or callId is required)

expiryDateMonth.description:
[Length<=2] This is the expiry month of the card for the transaction. Format is 'MM'
(CONDITIONAL: Required when using cardNumber)

expiryDateYear.description:
[Length =4 or =2] This is the expiry year of the card for the transaction. Format is 'CCYY' or 'YY'
(CONDITIONAL: Required when using cardNumber)

originalTransactionId.description: [Length=36] This is the "id" returned in a Card Transaction Response. This must be populated when performing a reversalSale or reversalPreAuthorization in order to reverse a specific payment

cardHolderName.description:
[Length<=50] This is the name of cardholder as displayed on the card.
For the purpose of fraud based risk checks, it is highly recommended that this is supplied.

encryptionId.description: [Length=36] This is the unique Encryption ID obtained from PXP following an Encryption key Reesponse (Required if submitting an encrypted card number)

encryptionType.description: This is the type of encryption used to encrypt the card number, sucah as "rsaTwoFourZeroEight"  (Required if submitting an encrypted card number)

cardVerificationValue.description: [Length<=4] This is the Card Verification Value, for American Express cards this is set to 4 digits, all other cards are set to 3

countryCode.description: [Length=3] This is the country code of the card holder in ISO-3166-1 Alpha-3 code format

status.description:
This is the final status during the 3D Secure process. Refer to ThreeDSecure Status under Elements
(CONDITIONAL: Required if not supplying threeDSecureId)

threeDSecureVersion.description:
This is the 3D Secure version returned by PXP's Three D Secure Service. Must be in the format N.N.N
(CONDITIONAL: Required if not supplying threeDSecureId)

eci.description:
[Length<=2] This is the E-Commerce Indicator (ECI). This value will be returned only on payer authentication transactions, or for enrollments where the issuer is non-participating and the card scheme supports it. This value must be appended to the authorization request, where it enables the interchange benefits granted to merchants processing payer Authentication transactions. Refer to ThreeDSecure Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI) under Elements
(CONDITIONAL: Required if not supplying threeDSecureId)

cavv.description:
[Length<=32] This is the Cardholder Authentication Verification Value, indicating that the transaction has been authenticated. This value should be appended to the authorization request signifying that the transaction has been successfully authenticated.
(CONDITIONAL: Required if not supplying threeDSecureId)

xid.description:
[Length<=28] This is the 3DS 1.0 transaction identifier returned by the card issuer
(CONDITIONAL: Required if not supplying threeDSecureId)

dsTransId.description:
[Length=36] This is the 3DS 2.0 transaction identifier returned by the card issuer
(CONDITIONAL: Required if not supplying threeDSecureId)

threeDSecureId.description:
[Length=36] This is the unique "id" GUID returned by PXP during the 3D Secure Redirect Authentication process. (Both the 3DS Redirect Response, and when redirected back to the successUrl or errorUrl)
If supplied, PXP will lookup the 3DS data to include in the Authorisation Request
(CONDITIONAL: Required if not supplying all other elements from this object)

streetAddress.description: [Length<=50] This is the street address of the cardholder.  This is only used for merchants processing through Worldpay US

city.description: [Length<=50] This is the city of the cardholder.  This is only used for merchants processing through Worldpay US

state.description: [Length<=50] This is the state location of the cardholder.  This is only used for merchants processing through Worldpay US

country.description: [Length<=50] This is the country of the cardholder.  This is only used for merchants processing through Worldpay US

cardOnfileIndicator.description: Refer to Card On File Indicator under Transaction Service Elements as to when this indicator should be used

merchantInitiatedTransaction.description: Refer to Merchant Initiated Transaction Indicator under Transaction Service Elements as to when this indicator should be used

returnCardSchemeReference.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the response will contain the element "cardSchemeReference", which is needed in new Merchant Initiated Transaction requests

variabilityIndicator.description: [fixed/variable]  This is used to confirm if the amount as part of a recurring payment is Fixed or Variable

scaExemption.description: This is the exemption to be applied against the transaction at authorisation. Refer to SCA Exemption under Elements

originalCreditType.description:
This is the original credit type which will be flagged to the card issuer.
Supported values are "gamblingPayout" and "onlineGamblingPayout"
Only supported for Vantiv by Worldpay.

fundingType.description:
This is the funding type which will be flagged to the card issuer.
Supported values are "creditCardAccount", "debitCardAccount", "prepaidCardAccount", "cash", "depositAccessAccount"
Only supported for Vantiv by Worldpay.

walletType.description:
This is the digital wallet type being used for the transaction.
Supported values are "applepay" or "googlepay"
Only supported for Vantiv by Worldpay.

clientSystemTransactionId.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the clientSystemTransactionId will be returned in the response

clientSystemInvoiceId.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the clientSystemInvoiceId will be returned in the response

providerResponseCodeResult.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the providerResponseCodeResult will be returned in the response

providerCardSecurityResponseCode.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the providerCardSecurityResponseCode will be returned in the response

providerAddressVerificationResponseCode.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the providerAddressVerificationResponseCode will be returned in the response

providerDiscretionaryData.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the providerDiscretionaryData will be returned in the response

providerRetrievalReferenceNumber.description: [True / False] If set to TRUE, the providerRetrievalReferenceNumber will be returned in the response

payerId.description:
[Length<=50] This is an Id used to uniquely identify the paying individual. It may be an internal account number or reference that the merchant holds for the individual from when they signed up to their site or service.
For the purpose of fraud based risk checks, it is highly recommended that this is supplied.

username.description:
[Length<=50] This is the individual's username that was used when making the payment, created when they signed up to the for the site or service.
For the purpose of fraud based risk checks, it is highly recommended that this is supplied.

emailAddress.description:
[Length<=100] This is the paying individual's email address.
For the purpose of fraud based risk checks, it is highly recommended that this is supplied.

firstName.description:
[Length<=50] This is the paying individual's first name.
For the purpose of fraud based risk checks, it is highly recommended that this is supplied.

lastName.description:
[Length<=50] This is the paying individual's last name.
For the purpose of fraud based risk checks, it is highly recommended that this is supplied.

clientIpAddress.description:
[Length<=50] This is the paying individual's Public IP address at the time of making the payment. This should be obtained from the browser session.
For the purpose of fraud based risk checks, it is highly recommended that this is supplied.

message.example: Error getting customer site for site no 1

get.description:
This Service is used to for Card / APM processing.

This request type can be used to get the transaction status and details of an APM transaction using the Transaction reference (clientSystemTransactionId or clientSystemInvoiceId) supplied in the original transaction request. The response will be an array of responses, as more than one transaction could use the same clientSystemInvoiceId

message.example: Couldn't find transaction for merchantId: BDD, storeId: BDD000000001 clientSystemTransactionId: UniqueTransactionReference
